result.execSummary:
The defendant April M Novak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).
  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).
  • Sex Assault of Student by School Staff, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 37 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 and 3.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.

No contact with D. H., Menomonee Falls High School nor any school except for her children's.
No contact with ex-husband (Christopher) but only as he deems appropriate and with family court orders.
No contact with Rebecca S.
Engage in Sex Offender Treatment.
Register as a Sex Offender.
Internet restrictions as appropriate by the agent.
Not to work or volunteer with any private school setting.
No contact with minors as deemed appropriate by the agent.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Defendant April M Novak in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Hart.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes its recommendation to the Court.  Attorney Hart makes his recommendations to the Court.  Dr. Jeffrey Taxman makes statements to the Court.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 37 days) CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS 2 &3 COMMENCING FORTHWITH
  - 2  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT 
  -  3  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

*No contact with:  D.H., Menomonee Falls High School, any school except her children's, with ex-husband (Christopher) only as he deems appropriate and with family court orders,  and Rebecca S.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*To engage in Sex Offender treatment
*Register as a Sex Offender
*Internet restrictions as appropriate by the agent
*Not to work or volunteer with any private school setting
*No contact with minors as deemed appropriate by the agent

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 -Apply Cash Bail

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00  - Apply Cash Bail



COUNT 2

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 37 days)
 CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS 1 &3 COMMENCING FORTHWITH
  - 2  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
 
  -  3  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

*See Count 1 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 -Apply Cash Bail

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00- Apply Cash Bail

COUNT 3 -

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 37 days)
 CONCURRENT WITH COUNTS 1 &2 COMMENCING FORTHWITH
  - 2  YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
 
  -  3  YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

*See Count 1 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 -Apply Cash Bail

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00- Apply Cash Bail - REFUND BALANCE TO POSTER

Defendant is  not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is  not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
